verses.verse: Behold, He is coming with (Matt. 24:30) clouds, and every eye will see Him, even (Zech. 12:10-14; John 19:37) they who pierced Him. And all the tribes of the earth will mourn because of Him. Even so, Amen.
(Is. 41:4; Rev. 21:6; 22:13) “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End,” says the Lord, (Rev. 4:8; 11:17) “who is and who was and who is to come, the (Is. 9:6) Almighty.”

(Vision of the Son of Man) I, John, both your brother and (Phil. 1:7) companion in the tribulation and ((Rom. 8:17; 2 Tim. 2:12)) kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was on the island that is called Patmos for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.
(Acts 10:10) I was in the Spirit on (Acts 20:7) the Lord’s Day, and I heard behind me (Rev. 4:1) a loud voice, as of a trumpet,

saying, “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last,” and, “What you see, write in a book and send it to the seven churches which are in Asia: to Ephesus, to Smyrna, to Pergamos, to Thyatira, to Sardis, to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea.”
Then I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. And having turned (Ex. 25:37; Zech. 4:2; Rev. 1:20; 2:1) I saw seven golden lampstands,

(Rev. 2:1) and in the midst of the seven lampstands (Ezek. 1:26; Dan. 7:13; 10:16; Rev. 14:14) One like the Son of Man, (Dan. 10:5) clothed with a garment down to the feet and (Rev. 15:6) girded about the chest with a golden band.
His head and (Dan. 7:9) hair were white like wool, as white as snow, and (Dan. 10:6; Rev. 2:18; 19:12) His eyes like a flame of fire;
(Ezek. 1:7; Dan. 10:6; Rev. 2:18) His feet were like fine brass, as if refined in a furnace, and (Ezek. 1:24; 43:2; Rev. 14:2; 19:6) His voice as the sound of many waters;

(Rev. 1:20; 2:1; 3:1) He had in His right hand seven stars, (Is. 49:2; (Heb. 4:12); Rev. 2:12, 16; 19:15) out of His mouth went a sharp two-edged sword, (Matt. 17:2; Acts 26:13; Rev. 10:1) and His countenance was like the sun shining in its strength.

And (Ezek. 1:28) when I saw Him, I fell at His feet as dead. But (Dan. 8:18; 10:10, 12) He laid His right hand on me, saying to me, “Do not be afraid; (Is. 41:4; 44:6; 48:12; Rev. 2:8; 22:13) I am the First and the Last.
(Rom. 6:9; Rev. 2:8; 10:6; 15:7) I am He who lives, and was dead, and behold, (Rev. 4:9) I am alive forevermore. Amen. And (Ps. 68:20) I have the keys of Hades and of Death.
Write the things which you have (Rev. 1:9-18) seen, (Rev. 2:1) and the things which are, (John 16:13; Rev. 4:1) and the things which will take place after this.

The mystery of the seven stars which you saw in My right hand, and the seven golden lampstands: The seven stars are (Mal. 2:7; Rev. 2:1) the angels of the seven churches, and (Ex. 25:37; 37:23; Zech. 4:2; Matt. 5:15; Phil. 2:15) the seven lampstands which you saw are the seven churches.

(The Loveless Church) “To the angel of the church of Ephesus write, ‘These things says (Rev. 1:16) He who holds the seven stars in His right hand, (Rev. 1:13) who walks in the midst of the seven golden lampstands:

(Ps. 1:6) “I know your works, your labor, your patience, and that you cannot bear those who are evil. And (John 6:6; 1 John 4:1) you have tested those (2 Cor. 11:13) who say they are apostles and are not, and have found them liars;
and you have persevered and have patience, and have labored for My name’s sake and have (Gal. 6:9; Heb. 12:3, 5) not become weary.
Nevertheless I have this against you, that you have left your first love.
Remember therefore from where you have fallen; repent and do the first works, (Matt. 21:41) or else I will come to you quickly and remove your lampstand from its place—unless you repent.
But this you have, that you hate the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

(Matt. 11:15; Rev. 2:11, 17; 3:6, 13, 22; 13:9) “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give ((Rev. 22:2, 14)) to eat from ((Gen. 2:9; 3:22)) the tree of life, which is in the midst of the Paradise of God.” ’
(The Persecuted Church) “And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write, ‘These things says (Rev. 1:8, 17, 18) the First and the Last, who was dead, and came to life:
“I know your works, tribulation, and poverty (but you are (Luke 12:21) rich); and I know the blasphemy of (Rom. 2:17) those who say they are Jews and are not, (Rev. 3:9) but are a synagogue of Satan.

(Matt. 10:22) Do not fear any of those things which you are about to suffer. Indeed, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tested, and you will have tribulation ten days. (Matt. 24:13) Be faithful until death, and I will give you (James 1:12) the crown of life.
(Rev. 13:9) “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. He who overcomes shall not be hurt by ((Rev. 20:6, 14; 21:8)) the second death.” ’
(The Compromising Church) “And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write, ‘These things says (Is. 49:2; Rev. 1:16; 2:16) He who has the sharp two-edged sword:

“I know your works, and where you dwell, where Satan’s throne is. And you hold fast to My name, and did not deny My faith even in the days in which Antipas was My faithful martyr, who was killed among you, where Satan dwells.

But I have a few things against you, because you have there those who hold the doctrine of (Num. 31:16) Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling block before the children of Israel, (Num. 25; Acts 15:29; (1 Cor. 10:20); Rev. 2:20) to eat things sacrificed to idols, (1 Cor. 6:13) and to commit sexual immorality.
Thus you also have those who hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.
